wiki.summary: “Love Me More” is the first track on Sam Smith’s fourth album Gloria, released on 27 January 2023. It was also Sam’s first release of 2022 following their third studio album, Love Goes, in 2020. The song has a catchy, emphatic beat that stays with the listener. The lyric deals with the subject of low self-esteem and overcoming self-hatred to achieve a more positive outlook, but does so with a subtle hint of humour and self-mockery. Two subsequent acoustic versions Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: “Love Me More” is the first track on Sam Smith’s fourth album Gloria, released on 27 January 2023. It was also Sam’s first release of 2022 following their third studio album, Love Goes, in 2020. The song has a catchy, emphatic beat that stays with the listener. The lyric deals with the subject of low self-esteem and overcoming self-hatred to achieve a more positive outlook, but does so with a subtle hint of humour and self-mockery. Two subsequent acoustic versions, one with piano accompaniment and the other guitar have been received positively on social media. “I wrote this song for anyone who feels different, anyone who has to stop themselves every day from saying unkind things to themselves, in their head, all the time. I felt like that for the longest time and slowly I’m learning how to just be nice to myself. I wanted to share that because I captured it in this song. Over the last two years, music has been my therapy more than ever. So I hope this song can be your friend.“ - via Press Release Read more on Last.fm.
